component.description: The switcher component dynamically decides which facet component should be rendered.

property.description: the name of the facet to render and process.
the name of the facet to render and process if "facetName" is null or otherwise does not refer to an existing facet.

component-extension.mfp:long-description: The switcher component dynamically decides which facet component should be rendered. It has two properties. The switcher will render the facet matching "facetName"; however, if no such facet exists (or "facetName" is null), and "defaultFacet" has been set, then that facet will be used instead. (It's possible to achieve this same functionality by using a panelGroup and binding the "rendered" property of each child, but this component can be simpler. Ordinary children of the switcher component are not rendered at all.)

mfp:example.mfp:source-code: <tr:switcher facetName="#{userData.person}" defaultFacet="default"> <f:facet name="default"> <tr:outputText value="You have not picked anyone I know"/> </f:facet > <f:facet name="Roger"> <tr:outputText value="You have picked Roger"/> </f:facet > <f:facet name="Peter"> <tr:outputText value="You have picked Peter"/> </f:facet > </tr:switcher>
